segment.source: Recovery console Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and folders (Windows 10)
segment.target: Recovery console Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and folders (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Recovery console Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and folders security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Recovery console Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and folders security policy setting.

segment.source: Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and folders
segment.target: Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and folders

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and folders security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and folders security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting enables or disables the Recovery Console SET command, which allows you to set the following Recovery Console environment variables.
segment.target: This policy setting enables or disables the Recovery Console SET command, which allows you to set the following Recovery Console environment variables.

segment.source: Enables wildcard support for some commands, such as the DEL command.
segment.target: Enables wildcard support for some commands, such as the DEL command.

segment.source: Allows access to all files and folders on the device.
segment.target: Allows access to all files and folders on the device.

segment.source: Allows files to be copied to removable media, such as a floppy disk.
segment.target: Allows files to be copied to removable media, such as a floppy disk.

segment.source: Suppresses the prompt that typically displays before an existing file is overwritten.
segment.target: Suppresses the prompt that typically displays before an existing file is overwritten.

segment.source: You might forget to remove removable media, such as CD or floppy disk, with sensitive data or applications that a malicious user could then steal.
segment.target: You might forget to remove removable media, such as CD or floppy disk, with sensitive data or applications that a malicious user could then steal.

segment.source: Or you could accidentally leave a startup disk in the computer after using the Recovery Console.
segment.target: Or you could accidentally leave a startup disk in the computer after using the Recovery Console.

segment.source: If the device is restarted for any reason and the BIOS has been configured to boot from the removable media before the hard disk drive, the server will start from the removable disk.
segment.target: If the device is restarted for any reason and the BIOS has been configured to boot from the removable media before the hard disk drive, the server will start from the removable disk.

segment.source: This causes the server's network services to be unavailable.
segment.target: This causes the server's network services to be unavailable.

segment.source: Set Recovery Console: Allow floppy copy and access to drives and folders to Disabled.
segment.target: Set Recovery Console: Allow floppy copy and access to drives and folders to Disabled.

segment.source: Users who have started a server by using the Recovery Console and logged in with the built-in Administrator account will not be able to copy files and folders to a floppy disk.
segment.target: Users who have started a server by using the Recovery Console and logged in with the built-in Administrator account will not be able to copy files and folders to a floppy disk.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Setting and deploying this policy using Group Policy takes precedence over the setting on the local device.
segment.target: Setting and deploying this policy using Group Policy takes precedence over the setting on the local device.

segment.source: Enabling this security option makes the Recovery Console SET command available, which allows you to set the following Recovery Console environment variables:
segment.target: Enabling this security option makes the Recovery Console SET command available, which allows you to set the following Recovery Console environment variables:

segment.source: AllowWildCards: Enable wildcard support for some commands (such as the DEL command).
segment.target: AllowWildCards: Enable wildcard support for some commands (such as the DEL command).

segment.source: AllowAllPaths: Allow access to all files and folders on the device.
segment.target: AllowAllPaths: Allow access to all files and folders on the device.

segment.source: AllowRemovableMedia: Allow files to be copied to removable media, such as a floppy disk.
segment.target: AllowRemovableMedia: Allow files to be copied to removable media, such as a floppy disk.

segment.source: NoCopyPrompt: Do not prompt when overwriting an existing file.
segment.target: NoCopyPrompt: Do not prompt when overwriting an existing file.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: An attacker who can cause the system to restart into the Recovery Console could steal sensitive data and leave no audit or access trail.
segment.target: An attacker who can cause the system to restart into the Recovery Console could steal sensitive data and leave no audit or access trail.

segment.source: Disable the Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to drives and folders setting.
segment.target: Disable the Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to drives and folders setting.

segment.source: Users who have started a server through the Recovery Console and logged in with the built-in Administrator account cannot copy files and folders to a floppy disk.
segment.target: Users who have started a server through the Recovery Console and logged in with the built-in Administrator account cannot copy files and folders to a floppy disk.
